alert.note: Alert for Brown; Butler; Clermont; Clinton; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ROBERTSON, SOUTHERN KENTON, BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, EASTERN GRANT, SOUTHEASTERN OWEN, PENDLETON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, CLERMONT, EASTERN HAMILTON, WESTERN BROWN, SOUTHERN WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Monroe to near Claryville to 9 miles northeast of Frankfort, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Mason, Lebanon, Fort Thomas, Sharonville, Wilmington, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Reading, Montgomery, Madeira, Alexandria, Milford, Deer Park, Georgetown, Blanchester, Williamstown, Falmouth and Claryville. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 9 and 40. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 158. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 21 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
